intro: Stephanomeria monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stephanomeria monocephala is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
